summary: The Colorado Outdoor Recreation and Economy Act (S.764) proposes designating wilderness areas, wildlife conservation areas, and recreation management areas in Colorado. It covers areas in the Continental Divide, San Juan Mountains, Thompson Divide, and Curecanti National Recreation Area. Key provisions include wilderness additions, land withdrawals, special management area designations, provisions for grazing and recreation, and the establishment of a pilot program for capturing fugitive methane emissions. It also addresses water rights, administrative provisions, and landowner assistance.
